Comment: Here's an interesting end-game from a recent league game against an opponent who has provided me with a number of challenges recently.
My usual response to 1.e4: the Sicilian.
White avoids the sharpest book lines.
Contesting d5
While White concentrates on developing his kingside minor pieces, Black uses his pawns to restrict their scope, particularly aiming for queenside pawn expansion and theatening to entrap White's KB.
